t: Woe*pn to those who scheme iniquity, Who*ln work out evil on their beds! When*ln morning comes, they do it, For*ln it is in the power of their hands.
They*ln covet fields and then seize them,*i And*ln houses, and take them*i away. They*ln rob a man and his house, A*ln man and his inheritance.

Therefore*p thus says the Lord,*s “Behold,*pn I am planning against this family a calamity From*ln which you cannot remove your necks; And*ln you will not walk haughtily, For*ln it will be an evil time.

On*ln that day they will take up against you a taunt And*ln utter a bitter lamentation and*i say, ‘We*ln are completely destroyed! He*ln exchanges the portion of my people; How*ln He removes it from me! To*ln the apostate He apportions our fields.’
Therefore*ln you will have no one stretching a measuring line For*ln you by lot in the assembly of the Lord.*s
‘Do*ln not speak out,’ so*i they speak out. But*iln if*i they do not speak out concerning these things, Reproaches*ln will not be turned back.
Is*ln it being said, O house of Jacob: ‘Is*ln the Spirit of the Lord*s impatient? Are*ln these His doings?’ Do*ln not My words do good To*ln the one walking uprightly?
Recently*ln My people have arisen as an enemy— You*ln strip the robe off the garment From*ln unsuspecting passers-by, From*iln those returned from war.
The*ln women of My people you evict, Each*ln one*i from her pleasant house. From*ln her children you take My splendor forever.
Arise*ln and go, For*ln this is no place of rest Because*ln of the uncleanness that brings on destruction, A*ln painful destruction.
If*ln a man walking after wind and falsehood Had*ln told lies and*i said,*i ‘I*ln will speak out to you concerning wine and liquor,’ He*ln would be spokesman to this people.

“I*ln will surely assemble all of you, Jacob, I*ln will surely gather the remnant of Israel. I*ln will put them together like sheep in the fold; Like*ln a flock in the midst of its pasture They*ln will be noisy with men.
The*ln breaker goes up before them; They*ln break out, pass through the gate and go out by it. So*ln their king goes on before them, And*ln the Lord*s at their head.”
